Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @Mylo notice how `confirmations` and `rawconfirmations` are different

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: that xtn really has 2 "raw" confirmations, but it's not notarized, so dpowconfs holds the confirmations at 1

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: there is a coinbase xtn with 102 confirmations, and since it's been notarized, rawconfirmations = confirmations

Author: D.rabbani#9094
Content: hi just a question while practicing .. if i want to get a block reward of 2.3% per year i.e. 5.29 mil /year how should i calculate the reward ? i am just confused

Author: D.rabbani#9094
Content: and what is ac_end ?

Author: D.rabbani#9094
Content: "for eg  ./komodod -ac_name=examplecoin   -ac_supply= 2300000000  -ac_reward= 367361111111   -ac_staked=100  -ac_cc=1  -ac_end=9799621"

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: -ac_end is when the blockrewards end

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the -ac_reward is the blockreward in satoshis

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: you can also use -ac_decay to reduce the blockreward incrementally

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: there is also -ac_halving

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: plz read the docs on this

Author: D.rabbani#9094
Content: yes read it

Author: D.rabbani#9094
Content: but my question is did i calculate it right ? the block reward

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: you can use getblocksubsidy <height> to verify the blockreward at a height

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: given an expanding supply and a fixed reward, the percentage wont be constant

Author: D.rabbani#9094
Content: will it generate 5.29 mil /year ?

Author: D.rabbani#9094
Content: okai

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: blocktime of 60 seconds

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: 1440 per day

Author: D.rabbani#9094
Content: yes

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: 1440*365 per year

Author: D.rabbani#9094
Content: yes

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: 1440*365 * blockreward per year

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: you can do the math

Author: D.rabbani#9094
Content: it is

Author: D.rabbani#9094
Content: if i want to keep 3.3% reward per year

Author: D.rabbani#9094
Content: it will be 1440*365*0.033 ? right

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: for the first year, but the supply is increasing, so the percentage will decrease

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: I think a negative -ac_decay is needed to increase the blockreward over time, but that is not implemented

Author: D.rabbani#9094
Content: no i just want to keep it fix just as 3.3% per year

Author: jl777c#5810
Content:
the supply is increasing, so the percentage will decrease
I think a negative -ac_decay is needed to increase the blockreward over time, but that is not implemented

Author: D.rabbani#9094
Content: okai

Author: D.rabbani#9094
Content: i got it

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: to keep a constant percentage, you would need to change the blockreward based on coinsupply

Author: D.rabbani#9094
Content: okai

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but with an ever changing blockreward, keeping track of that becomes problematic

Author: D.rabbani#9094
Content: the coin supply for example say 2.3 billion

Author: D.rabbani#9094
Content: and 2.3% will be block reward /year

Author: D.rabbani#9094
Content: out of it

Content: its okay i got it thanks
